bor = beginnig of the round k = knit co = cast on yo = yarn over k2tog = knit two stitches together wyif = with yarn in front sl1 k1 psso = slip one knit one pass slipped stitch over p = purl ws = wrong side 1 a l l u r e k n i t s rosemary bag about the rosemary bag features a delicate lace pattern and long i-cord straps this lightweight small bag is perfect for carrying just the essentials such as your phone and keys it is knitted in the round following a chart with the straps picked up and worked in the next step finally a lining is added for extra stability and structure a chart can be found at the end of the pattern pattern 1 bag 1 using 3 5 mm circular needles co 50 sts with judy s magic cast-on 25 sts per needle place a stitch marker for the bor 2 using the magic loop method work the lace pattern from the chart repeating 3 times or until desired length 3 k 3 rounds 4 switch to 3 mm needles for the cuff 5 k 3 rounds p 1 round k 3 rounds 6 fold the cuff tot he ws along the p round 7 in the next round k the cuff together with the first round of the cuff while binding-off 2 straps using 3 5 mm needles pick up 4 sts along one side of the bag knit an i-cord strap to the desired length please note that the strap will stretch slightly with wear pick up the same number of sts on the opposite side of the bag using the matress stitch sew the i-cord to the 4 sts just picked up 2 a l l u r e k n i t s rosemary bag finishing weave in all of the ends insert a lining measuring about 24 x 16 cm or according to the desired measurements chart 3 a l l u r e k n i t s
